page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF CHELMARSH
page.content: Chelmarsh is a small village 3 miles south of Bridgnorth and 3 miles north of Highley.It contains no shops but it has one post office.It also has a parish church called St.Peters which was built in 1345.Chelmarsh reservoir was built in 1965 and apart from storing water is used for sailing.The school was built in 1850 and has 42 pupils. Most of the land is used for growing grass for silage,barley,wheat and potatoes.If you go east from the village the land drops down to the River Severn.There is a ferry for people to cross at Hampton Loade and a foot bridge for employees of the water works opposite the reservoir.A privately owned steam railway runs parallel to the river between Bridgnorth and Kidderminster.There is a railway station at Hampton Loade.
